definition: lit. to be frustrated as though having lost sth (idiom)/fig. to be at a loss/perplexed/frustrated

sentences.english: From the area of southeast meter disconsolate, youhen full word.
sentences.chinese: 絕域從軍計惘然，東南幽恨滿詞箋。

sentences.english: Young we loved each other and ignorant .
sentences.chinese: 年輕時我們彼此相愛卻惘然不知。

sentences.english: Without her, a woman's beauty is Wang Ran.
sentences.chinese: 沒有她，女人的美麗便是惘然。

sentences.english: I knew I had to be strong, to put my sense of loss to one side and my feelings elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我必須堅強，把惘然和眷戀的情緒擱在一邊。

sentences.english: I looked mopishly at the sinuate black outline that you left behind, a tear dropped.
sentences.chinese: 我惘然對着你遺留下的黑曲線的輪廓掉下一滴淚來。

sentences.english: When I crossed the stile that had been there for 20 years, a spasm of void occupied my heart.
sentences.chinese: 跨過那條二十年如一的門檻，我心中一片惘然。

sentences.english: It is small enough, our part of the city, for us not to feel lost.
sentences.chinese: 這塊地方很小，我們不感到惘然若失。

sentences.english: When smell the taste lovers in dream I felt my own tears falling down.
sentences.chinese: 我聞見戀人遙遠夢中的氣息，淚水惘然。

sentences.english: Small Asia said expression was frustrated and a face, has a hint of sadness.
sentences.chinese: 小亞說這話時的表情是一臉的惘然，有着淡淡的哀傷。

sentences.english: One by one, and to continue to do the rainbow disconsolate.
sentences.chinese: 一一和彩虹惘然至若，繼續我行我素。

sentences.english: James was at a loss as to what to do and felt lost.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯無所適從，惘然若失。

sentences.english: But just by introducing a gender control on the group isn't going to make it any easier.
sentences.chinese: 但僅僅通過控制性別來達到目的，恐怕也只是惘然。

definition: anxious and perplexed/uneasy and confused/suspicious and fearful
as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
